places.name: Parque Nacional La Tigra
places.description: A beautiful cloud forest national park offering hiking trails, stunning biodiversity, and a visitor center. It's the primary source of water for the capital.

places.name: El Picacho
places.description: Home to the iconic Christ the Redeemer statue, this park offers the most panoramic views of Tegucigalpa and its surrounding areas.

places.name: Museo para la Identidad Nacional
places.description: Housed in a historic building, this museum showcases Honduran history, art, and culture, including a virtual tour of the Copan ruins.

places.name: Catedral de San Miguel Arcángel
places.description: The main cathedral of the city, an impressive example of colonial baroque architecture located in the heart of the historic center.

places.name: Valle de Ángeles
places.description: A charming and colorful colonial-era town just a short drive from the city, famous for its artisan crafts, souvenirs, and local cuisine.

places.name: Plaza de los Dolores
places.address: Next to Iglesia de Los Dolores, Tegucigalpa
places.description: A historic square featuring one of the city's oldest churches. It's a lively spot to experience the local atmosphere and street food.

places.name: Jardín Botánico de la UNAH
places.description: The botanical garden at the national university, providing a peaceful green space with a diverse collection of native Honduran plants.

places.name: Mercado de Artesanías Guamilito
places.description: A bustling market where you can find a wide variety of handmade crafts, leather goods, pottery, and traditional Honduran souvenirs.
